section.title: Creating ESXi GUEST DVS and Required Portgroup
section.para: The GUEST Distributed Virtual Switch is what connects the ESXi host to the &ostack; data network.

The process of creating an ESXi Guest Distributed vSwitch (DVS) consists of three steps: create a switch, add host and physical adapters, and add a port group. Use the following detailed instructions to create a guest DVS and a required portgroup.

step.para: Create the switch.
Using the vSphere webclient, connect to the vCenter server.
Under Hosts and cluster, right-click on the appropriate datacenter. Select Distributed Switch > New Distributed Switch.
Name the switch GUEST. Click Next.
Select version 6.0.0 or larger. Click Next.
Under Edit settings, select the appropriate number of uplinks. Uncheck Create a default port group. Click Next.
Under Ready to complete, verify the settings are correct. Click Finish.
Add host and physical adapters.
Under Networking, find the DVS named GUEST that was just created. Right-click on it and select Manage hosts.
Under Select task, select Add hosts. Click Next.
Click New hosts.
Select the current ESXi host and select OK. Then click Next.
Under Select network adapter tasks, select Manage physical adapters and UNCHECK all other boxes. Click Next.

Under Manage physical network adapters, click on the interface you are using to connect the ESXi to the &ostack; data network. The name would be of the kind vmnic# (for example, vmnic0, vmnic1). When the interface is highlighted, select Assign uplink then select the uplink name to assign or autoassign. Repeat the process for each uplink physical NIC you will be using to connect to the &ostack; data network. Click Next.
Verify that you understand and agree with the information shown by Analyze impact. Click Next.
Verify everything is correct. Click Finish.
Add port group.
Right-click on the DVS (GUEST) that was just created (or modified). Select Distributed Port Group > New Distributed Port Group.
Name the port group GUEST-PG. Click Next.
Under Configure settings, select:
Select Customize default policies configuration. Click Next.
Under Security, use the following settings:
Skip Traffic shaping and click Next.
Under Teaming and fail over, make changes appropriate for your network and deployment.
Skip Monitoring and click Next.
Skip Miscellaneous and click Next.
Under Edit addition settings, add a description if desired. Click Next.
Under Ready to complete, verify everything is as expected. Click Finish.
